''Health Providers and Elderly Clash on Medicare Funds'' (front page, May 15) focuses on two health issues before Congress: a Medicare prescription drug benefit and adequate financing for other Medicare services. It's not the case that Congress must choose one over the other.

As caregivers, we see up close the consequences when the elderly can't afford the medicine they need. Congress must ensure that they have access to affordable drugs. But we must also strengthen the foundation of the Medicare program, not chip away at it. The hospitals that the elderly rely on are under dire financial stress, and
Congress must provide additional relief. With a historic budget surplus, we believe there are ample resources for prescription drugs and other services.
DICK DAVIDSON President American Hospital Association Washington, May 17, 2000
